text.title: Pack for an Overnight Outdoor Festival

head.s: Pack for an Overnight Outdoor Festival

p.s: Are you preparing for a big overnight festival ?
Packing wisely can help you have a great time !

list.item:
Choose a Suitcase that will fit your clothes .
Depending on how long you stay , depend on how big your Suitcase should be .

item.s: Choose a Suitcase that is sturdy , and is weather resistant .
When going to a outdoor music festival , it can rain , and storm , so you want to make sure your Suitcase can keep your clothes dry , and one that wo n’t fall apart if it gets wet .

figure.rend: Pack for an Overnight Outdoor Festival Step 2.jpg

item.s: Use a Suitcase that you can easily carry , or pull .
You do n’t want your bag to be so big that you have a hard time traveling with it .

figure.rend: Pack for an Overnight Outdoor Festival Step 3.jpg

list.item: Research what the weather will be like the days you go .

item.s: Pick out your clothes .
Below , under Clothes , are some suggestions on what to take .

figure.rend: Pack for an Overnight Outdoor Festival Step 5.jpg

item.s: Make sure you pick your clothes to match the weather .
Make a plan of what you want to wear when .

figure.rend: Pack for an Overnight Outdoor Festival Step 6.jpg

item.s: Fold your clothes , so they will fit in your Suitcase .

figure.rend: Pack for an Overnight Outdoor Festival Step 7.jpg

item.s: Using your clothes plan , pack in chronological ( E. g , If you are going to the festival on Monday , and will be staying until Friday , pack the clothes you will wear on Friday on the bottom of your bag , and the clothes for Monday , on the top .
That way , they will be in order ) .

figure.rend: Pack for an Overnight Outdoor Festival Step 8.jpg

list.item:
Find your camp site .
This is the first thing you will do when you arrive at your destination .

item.s: Set up your tent .

figure.rend: Pack for an Overnight Outdoor Festival Step 10.jpg

item.s: Remember to put a tarp down under , and over your tent .
If you are staying in a RV , or motor home , you will need to get that all set up , and leveled .

list.item:
Pack up your clothes .
Any clothes you have out of your bag , make sure to put them all back in .
Check everywhere you have been to make sure you have everything , and are n’t leaving anything behind .

item.s: Take down your tent , and pack it up .

figure.rend: Pack for an Overnight Outdoor Festival Step 12.jpg

item.s: Clean up messes .
You want to leave your camp site the same way it was when you first arrived .

figure.rend: Pack for an Overnight Outdoor Festival Step 13.jpg

item.s: Pick up trash .
Take everything you brought with you .
Even though the festival will have vendors for food , it is good to bring your own food so you do n’t have to spend money every time you want something to eat , or drink .
You will want to pack all of this food in a cooler .
Either separate ones , or one big one .
You will need ice packs , and ice , to keep the food cold , and from spoiling .
For hot weather you will want to bring clothes that are made to worn in the summer , but you also want to be prepared for cool weather .
Always pack extra .
If you are going for 7 days , pack for 11 days .
Or , just to be prepared , pack for 14 days .

list.item:
Bring moisture wicking clothes , or natural fabrics .
Cotton
Linen .
Flannel
Hemp
Leather
Silk
Seersucker
Velvet
Denim
Corduroy
Mesh .
This is n’t a natural fabric , but it is good to wear in hot weather .

item.s: Shorts

list.item: Pajamas ( it could get cold at night , so bring long sleep wear , as well as light weight ones )
Sweatpants or yoga pants ( light weight , and or heavy )
Jackets ( light weight , and or heavy )
Sweat shirts ( light weight , and or heavy )
Toilet paper ( always a good thing to have , encase of an emergency )
Hair products ( Hair spray , leave in conditioner , ETC )

p.s: This is a list of objects you can use at your camp site , as well as for on the car ride down , so you have something to do when not participating in the festival .

item.s: Books , or magazines

list.item:
2 tarps , for under and over your tent .
So rain , and morning dew does n’t get in .

item.s: Food ( See , “ Food to Take . ” ) and drinks

list.item: Sandwiches ( Subs , peanut butter and jelly sandwiches , deli meat sandwiches , ETC )
Just Add Water Pancakes ( for if you have a grill )
Eggs ( for if you have a grill )

Water ( and lots of it ) .
You can bring re-usable water bottles so you can re-fill it .

item.s: Any sports drink ( Such as , Gatorade , Body Armor , and Red Bull )

list.item: Coffee ( You will need a french coffee maker )

item.s: Measuring cups

list.item: If you have one , bring a little propane grill .

item.s: Propane

p.s: You can put your first aid contents together in any plastic container .

item.s: Adhesive tape

list.item: Disposable gloves , at least two pair
Gauze pads , and roller gauze in assorted sizes
Plastic bags to act as a trash can
Sterile eyewash , such as a saline solution
Activated charcoal ( use only if instructed by your poison control center )
Aspirin and non-aspirin pain relievers ( never give aspirin to children )
Medications that do n't need refrigeration
Small , waterproof flashlight and extra batteries
